intro: Neurophyllodes hololeuca, commonly known as the white-flowered neurophyllodes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
